![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)Some Active Directory attributes return an 8 byte integer in the form of an [IADsLargeInteger](file://\\LargeInteger) interface. An example is the pwdLastSet attribute from a user object.

Because the IADsLargeInteger object doesn’t provide type information PowerShell cannot read the HighPart and LowPart properties.

So I wrote the function below to get the Int64 value of an IADsLargeInteger:

  
“&gt;
